data.message: i just got scammed.   evan doege said he worked at fb and that i won 50k from a 'promotion'

replies.message: We agree, Elizabeth. This sounds like a hoax. We suggest that you don't provide any personal information, and report spam using these tips: http://on.fb.me/1RGRSA0. Thanks for helping us keep Facebook safe. -Jordan
Was the scammer William Voyles Frederick? He is messaging today, saying he works for Facebook and I have won 474,000.00
That sounds foolish. The amount is outrageous.
There is a guy named Horton Andre Lamont saying he works for facebook said I won 600.000 dollars that I have to pay 500 to 350 to get this money I know it's not true

I Like Facebook!! They are exploiting you way more than anyone else. Our browsers are highjacked by thier money making ideas. They could protect you more, but they are busy putting thier hands in your pocket. Your private info!! Im just saying they could do better at protecting people who are making them alot of money..  Their users..

I have received two friend requests from people who said they work for fb . I think that's odd, so I deleted them. I've stopped accepting requests as of the past couple of weeks. Some people have no friends or photos listed.
Asking for money up front to claim your "winnings" is a dead give-away.
